RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Possui doutorado em Discipline filosofiche - Universitá di Pisa (2010). Tem experiência na área de Filosofia, com ênfase em Filosofia, atuando principalmente no seguinte tema: chaos, determinism, non-linearity, biology, wittgenstein, Nietzsche. 

Specialization fields:
Philosophy of science, Philosophy of physics, Philosophy of biology, History of modern science, History of modern mathematics, Philosophy of language, philosophical Hermeneutics, History of philosophy.

Present position:
I?m currently collaborating with

? Complexité et information morphologiques (CIM) Centre Cavaillès, École Normale Supérieure, Paris (prof. Giuseppe Longo).

? Centro interdisciplinare di studi sulla complessità (prof. University of Pisa, Departement of Phisics). L. Fronzoni,

? National research project ?La ricezione della filosofia di Nietzsche e delle sue conseguenze nella biblioteca, nelle letture e nelle opere di ThomasMann? (Prof. L. Crescenzi, University of Pisa, Departement of humanities).
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN: graduation at Philosophy from Universitá di Pisa (2004) and doctorate at Discipline filosofiche from Universitá di Pisa (2010). He is currently pesquisador at Ecole Normale Supérieure Paris and pos-doc at Universidade Estadual de Campinas. Has experience in Philosophy, focusing on Philosophy, acting on the following subjects: physique, relation, biologie, filosofia da ciencia and historia da fisica.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-ORGAO: Instituto de Filosofia e Ciências Humanas

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Nietzsche's eternal recurrence. New sources and new interpretation
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
By this project I intend to propose a new interpretation of Nietzsche?s eternal recurrence. New sources, found by prof. Luca Crescenzi and myself, impose to reconsider in a new way the relation between free will and
determinism in Nietzsche?s thought. Starting from the reading of Du Bois-Reymond?s speech ?Die sieben Welträtsel ?, Nietzsche drops the laplacean determinism and introduces the idea of free will in his thought. The turning point of Nietzsche?s philosophy is the renewed scientific controversy about determinism and free will around 1880. Scientists introduced the possibility of free will in nature from a mathematical and physical point o view. The elaboration of eternal recurrence shows Nietzsche?s interest in this debate. The current interpretation
states a continuity between eternal recurrence and determinism exposed by Nietzsche in ?Human, all too human?. The question is: if Nietzsche?s thought is deterministic, why does Nietzsche decided to create Zarathustra or to write only about ethical and aesthetic problems after 1881? My work fits into very
interesting development of Brazilian Nietzsche?s research.
